Cortical flat map.Definition: A two-dimensional, unfolded representation of the cerebral cortex that displays the entire hemisphere in one view requiring artificial cuts that disrupt the continuity between nearby cortical locations. The flat map uses a technique based on information contained in outlines of histological sections and allows an entire hemisphere to be represented on a single cortical map. For an example see Figure 2E, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3288593/figure/F2/
